text:
Let's find out the source
of his power.

When you are pushing your
personal absolute limit,

there's nothing better
for the glory of God.
I've been a pastor for 28 years

and I perform feats of strength
to inspire others.

I didn't expect
to become a minister.

I'm a guy who likes
to wear shorts
and listen to rock and roll.

I felt like God was calling me
to help people.

Feats of strength
were a great metaphor.
Each thing that we do,

there's always
a message behind it.

My wife, Amy, has been with me
from the very beginning.

We've had emergency room visits,
having my hand lit on fire,
shattered elbows.

God gave me
the gift of strength.

And tonight, I want to use it
for His glory.
It makes you feel blessed that

I was called
to the "Go-Big Show"
to entertain people,

but also to help motivate
and change their lives.
[ Cheers and applause ]
[ Horns honking ]
Man: She seems really nervous.

Rosario: I'm seeing motorcycles,
I'm getting a little nervous.

Cody: Leave it
to the Lord, baby.
This past year,

our strength has been tested
in many different ways.

Tonight, I want to demonstrate
for you that

in the face of adversity,
you can still stand strong.
Let me show you what I mean.

How much of those
motorcycles weigh, Jon?

One is 500.
The other one 700.

We're going to take
each one of these bikes.
We're can take one on one arm.

We're gonna take the other
on the other arm.

And I'm going to tell
these guys to rip it.

They are going to literally
try to tear me in two.
[ Audience groans ]

But I'm not going anywhere.
Neither are they.
[ Motorcycles rev ]

Hell, yeah,
audio is loving this.
Whoo!
[ Motorcycles rev ]

Really dangerous,
really dangerous.

We're about to watch a man
get torn asunder.

Kreischer: There's thousands of
pounds of pressure on each arm.

If he loses his grip,
it could tear his arm off.

I'm so afraid.
I'm really afraid
right now, too.

Two motorcycles
going two different ways.

Man: Pastor Jon,
are you ready?
Ready. Tension.

Need more tension
on that side.
Man: Bikes set!
All: Three, two, one...
Aah!
Aah!
Man: Three, two, one,
bikes stop!
Oh, my God.
[ Motorcycles rev ]

[ Cheers and applause ]
Holy crap!

Don't let anything,
anything tear you apart.
Whoo!
[ Cheers and applause ]
Holy crap!
[ Cheers and applause ]
Goose bumps, man.

Can we just point out that
you're totally not out of breath

from doing that?
[ Laughs ] Yeah.

As a person that wants
a motorcycle,
I know that was difficult to do.
The pure strength and the power

and the confidence, damn,
that was cool as hell.
Thank you.

It was something
I'm going to hold on to

and think of in times of
struggle for myself.
For sure.

100% from
the world of pro wrestling,

we're always trying really hard
to tell this nuanced story.

You were
a master of presenting,

but I definitely want
to see more, for sure.

-Impressive, brother.
-Thank you.
